DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response for questions related to BI-RADS and lesion assessments.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS) Atlas is a quality assurance guide to standardize breast-imaging reporting and to facilitate outcome monitoring. The atlas contains a guide to standardized mammographic reporting, including a breast-imaging lexicon of terminology, a report organization and assessment structure and coding system._A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS) Atlas is a quality assurance guide to standardize breast-imaging reporting and to facilitate outcome monitoring. The atlas contains a guide to standardized mammographic reporting, including a breast-imaging lexicon of terminology, a report organization and assessment structure and coding system.

Concepts.longName: Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System
Concepts.definition: The Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS) Atlas is a quality assurance guide to standardize breast-imaging reporting and to facilitate outcome monitoring. The atlas contains a guide to standardized mammographic reporting, including a breast-imaging lexicon of terminology, a report organization and assessment structure and coding system.

The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the participant have at
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant have at least 1 lesion of 3-5 BI-RADS score?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN 6702
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have at least one MRI-detected lesion, which has not been previously biopsied, categorized as either BI-RADS 3, 4, or 5 based on DCE-MRI only (without reference to DWI)?

DataElement.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
